Posts.Content: Congrats on finishing radiation...Will be wishing you and our other pink sisters well this week....And, I'll bring the iced tea & chips on the bus...(love potato chips).
Posts.Title: GrannaBeth Needs the PINK BUS -Can you please come along?

Posts.Content: Wondering if any of you lovely ladies have had/heard of others having breast cancer in the opposite breast? I had a left breast mastectomy 2 years ago, and a nightmare of surgeries trying to reconstruct that side...Now, I get hit with the possibility of this on my right side...I am scheduled for a mammogram and ultrasound on Monday (4/27) to check what my doctor felt today...I’ve had a chronic cough that the doctors can’t figure out...and, for about a week now I have had pain on the right side – it hurts every time I cough, sneeze or laugh - thus my visit to the doctor for the umpteenth time...I wasn’t expecting news about a lump on the breast.  Anyway, I’m sure it’s going to come back as a cyst or something…But, was just wondering if anybody had any news of cancer on the opposite side - and if it hits even harder than before... Thank you for listening, Andi :)
Posts.Title: Possible - Contralateral Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: VickiSam, Thank you for the update...Such a fighter - and will continue to keep her in our thoughts... Andi
Posts.Title: Monday, January 17th -- Update on Eileen

Posts.Content: Today was my last day of radiation...I chose to have a masectomy after the breast mri showed a 2nd lump. I thought, wonderful - I won't have to go thru radiation...wrong!!!...2 surgeries later, the doctor still couldn't 'clear margins'. Therefore, I ended up needing radiation......Today was a bit 'bitter sweet'...I've gotten to know the nurses & rad techs - and now I won't see them except for the doctor's appts...Anyway, cheers to me. (holding up a fake glass of wine  )...Though I haven't posted much, these discussion boards have been a great place to go since you all know how I feel and what I was going thru...It has been a great help...So, thank you all so very much - you lovely ladies out there...Cheers to all of us!!! Andi
Posts.Title: Another Rad Grad Today...YEA !!!

Posts.Content: My screen name is just my nick name Andi and the 44 is the age when I was diagnosed...What a fun topic of discussion...
Posts.Title: screen names-curuious if what they mean to everyone

Posts.Content: That is great news Margeaux - Go celebrate.... Andi :)
Posts.Title: Good visit to the oncologists

Posts.Content: I just wanted to wish all you lovely ladies a wonderful holiday season filled with family, friends and of course great food. This time of year is also when we seem to reflect on the year that has passed…I urge you to pray and/or offer support to those that need it the most. Again, Happy Holidays… Andi
Posts.Title: Sending Holiday Wishes

Posts.Content: Janice, sending positive thoughts her way...thank you dear one for asking for support...Andi
Posts.Title: Prayers needed now for Dawne please

Posts.Content: Hope you had a nice Christmas - did you get any gifts with the Disney Theme?  Andi  :)
